title: Tiny owl rescued from New York Rockefeller Center Christmas tree
description: The saw-whet owl is doing well after its unplanned three-day road trip to the Big Apple.

title: Queen's Gambit: Chess on the rise due to drama series
description: The popularity of chess is rocketing with five times the number of new online players than last year.

title: Covid-19: Twins delivered in Birmingham while mother in coma
description: Perpetual Uke says she struggled to believe they were her children when she awoke 16 days later.

title: Green targets: Do governments meet them?
description: As the UK government unveils new environmental targets, what about the previous ones?

title: Covid: What help is available to pay my bills?
description: Mortgage and rent holidays, help with debts, and cutting energy and insurance bills are all possible.

title: Covid spending: Watchdog finds MPs' contacts were given priority
description: The spending watchdog found £10.5bn was spent on pandemic-related contracts awarded without competitive tender.

title: Covid vaccine: Pfizer says it's '94% effective in over 65s'
description: The companies say they will now apply for authorisation for emergency use of the jab in the US.

title: Coronavirus: Head of NHS Test and Trace Dido Harding self-isolating
description: Two NHS bosses - Baroness Harding and medical director Stephen Powis - are told to stay at home.

title: Covid mass testing rolled out to Merthyr Tydfil
description: The county is the first part of Wales where the scheme will be rolled out, with the help of the military.

title: Coronavirus: Family Christmas get-togethers being considered
description: Rules could be relaxed for a few days, with people urged to travel by car and not hold big gatherings.

title: Jeremy Corbyn will not return as Labour MP, says Sir Keir Starmer
description: The former Labour leader has been let back into the party, but will continue to sit as an independent MP.

title: How electric cars are charged and how far they go: your questions answered
description: We answer your top questions on electric cars - on charging, on range and on battery life.

title: Apple slashes commission fees to developers on its App Store
description: Those who earn less than $1m this year will see their commission charge halved in 2021.

title: House prices rise as Covid sparks rural relocation
description: Property prices in the South West of England have risen fastest in the UK, official statistics show.

title: UK climate plan: What do the terms mean?
description: Ahead of a UK plan to reach "net zero", we guide you through some of the key terms in climate change.

title: Ban on new petrol and diesel cars in UK from 2030 under PM's green plan
description: The PM confirms he is bringing the ban forward as he sets out his "green industrial revolution".

title: England to play in Pakistan for first time in 16 years
description: England will tour Pakistan for the first time in 16 years when they play two Twenty20 internationals next October.

title: Dolly Parton 'honoured and proud' to help Covid-19 battle
description: Parton's $1m donation helped fund a vaccine's trials and research into other coronavirus treatments.

title: Lewis Hamilton: 'No-one's doing the homework' on diversity in F1
description: Formula 1 driver Lewis Hamilton spoke to CBS This Morning about the lack of diversity in Formula 1.

title: 'There are more cricketers than footballers' - the Englishman coaching the Brazil women's team
description: Liam Cook, with the help of Jonty Rhodes, five-a-side football and the local mayor, is aiming to put Brazilian cricket on the map.

title: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez to fight Briton Callum Smith on 19 December
description: British WBA world super-middleweight champion Callum Smith will fight Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez in the United States on 19 December.

title: 'I could ruin 13 years at Chelsea' - Lampard on why management is harder than playing
description: Chelsea manager Frank Lampard tells Eddie Hearn why life as a manager presents more challenges than years spent as a player.

title: Liverpool injury problems: Do Reds need to sign a defender?
description: As Joe Gomez joins Virgil van Dijk on the sidelines, do Liverpool need to buy a defender in January - or can they find a solution from within their squad? BBC Sport assesses Jurgen Klopp's options.

title: The Players podcast: Man City stars Sam Mewis and Rose Lavelle guess Manchester slang
description: Watch Manchester City and USA stars Sam Mewis and Rose Lavelle try to guess the meaning of some Manchester slang in this week's The Players podcast.

title: Lord Feldman: Department of Health adviser's firm took work from Covid company
description: Lord Feldman went to meetings between ministers and a biotech firm his PR company went on to advise.

title: Fighting loneliness: 'My new friend is 79'
description: BBC Radio 1 Newsbeat speaks to young people about how they got through it.

title: The Papers: Covid deals 'concern' and 'plan to save Christmas'
description: Wednesday's papers focus on a public spending watchdog report and on festive gathering plans.

title: New Zealand Police introduce hijab to uniform
description: Constable Zeena Ali will become the first in the force’s history to wear the specially designed hijab

title: India tiger awaits mate after 'longest' 3,000 km journey
description: The tiger travelled 3,000 km in nine months, the furthest a big cat is known to have walked in India.

title: Asia's forgotten musical gems rediscovered on vinyl
description: Long-lost classics are gaining a new audience on vinyl, as Asia's forgotten music is rediscovered.

title: Brexit: What's happening and what comes next?
description: Covid-19 and the US election have dominated headlines, but Brexit crunch time is approaching fast.

title: Blakeney Nature Reserve: Record seal pup births predicted
description: Rangers at the UK's largest seal colony expect to smash last winter's record of 3,399 births.

title: Civil war massacre 'cover-up' exposed by historian
description: Around 160 people may have died when the Royalist stronghold of Shelford was stormed in 1645.

title: Dominic Cummings 'turns up with PM in Beanotown'
description: Children's comic the Beano features the PM's chief adviser in a strip aimed at cheering up adults.

title: The loyalty oath keeping Rwandans abroad in check
description: Leaked footage fuels allegations of an aggressive crackdown on Rwandan "critics" in the diaspora.

title: 'I can't let go of my remaining embryos'
description: Two mothers describe the painful process of ending embryo storage.

title: Son of Grenfell Tower fire victim: 'My mother could have survived'
description: The son of a woman who died in the Grenfell Tower fire is taking the government to court over evacuation plans for high-rise buildings.
